comments:
Build ID: I20070621-1340

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Make a dynamic web page
2. Insert a Panel grid into a JSP page. Use the web page visual editor.
3. Try to set the "cellpadding" property.

Error call stack is:
java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.String cannot be cast to org.eclipse.jst.pagedesigner.css2.value.Length
	at org.eclipse.jst.pagedesigner.css2.property.PaddingWidthMeta.calculateHTMLAttributeOverride(PaddingWidthMeta.java:61)
	at org.eclipse.jst.pagedesigner.css2.style.AbstractStyle.calculateProperty(AbstractStyle.java:180)
	at org.eclipse.jst.pagedesigner.css2.style.AbstractStyle.getStyleProperty(AbstractStyle.java:114)
	at org.eclipse.jst.pagedesigner.css2.style.AbstractStyle.getInsetProperty(AbstractStyle.java:395)
	at org.eclipse.jst.pagedesigner.css2.style.AbstractStyle.getPaddingInsets(AbstractStyle.java:365)
	at org.eclipse.jst.pagedesigner.css2.layout.CSSFigure.getInsets(CSSFigure.java:494)
	at org.eclipse.draw2d.Figure.translateToParent(Figure.java:1708)


More information:
Consistently seems to be reproducable with this JSP code. Use the Web Page Editor and try to add a cellpadding property to panelGrid using code complete.

<%@taglib uri="http://java.sun.com/jsf/core" prefix="f"%><%@taglib
	uri="http://java.sun.com/jsf/html" prefix="h"%><%@ page language="java" contentType="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1"
    pageEncoding="ISO-8859-1"%>
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">
<html>

<body>

<f:view>
	<h:form>

		<h:panelGrid columns="2">
			<h:outputText value="item1"></h:outputText>
			<h:outputText value="item2"></h:outputText>
			<h:outputText value="item3"></h:outputText>
			<h:outputText value="item4"></h:outputText>
		</h:panelGrid>	
	</h:form>
</f:view>
</body>
</html>
